alert.note: Alert for Campbell (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued January 09 at 6:41PM EST until January 10 at 3:00AM EST by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WATCH FOR THE POTENTIAL FAILURE OF COLLEGE LAKE DAM ON THE BLACKWATER CREEK NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 AM EST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Flash Flooding caused by a potential dam or levee failure continues to be possible at the College Lake Dam. * WHERE...A portion of central Virginia, including the following county, Campbell. * WHEN...Until 3 AM EST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Dam failure may result in flash flooding of low-lying areas below the dam. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - 2 to 3 inches of rain fell across the Blackwater Creek basin through the day, with the runoff continuing to collect in College Lake. The operators of College Lake Dam report that College Lake continues to rise this evening. - For flooding safety information, please visit http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM EST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of central Virginia, including the following county, Campbell. * WHEN...Until 1 AM EST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - For flooding safety information, please visit http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
